title:
A law of large numbers concerning the number of critical points of
  isotropic Gaussian functions
abstract:
Let $\Phi$ be a smooth isotropic random Gaussian function $\Phi$ on
$\mathbb{R}^m$. Denote by $Z_N(\Phi)$ the number of critical points of $\Phi$
inside the cube $[0,N]^m$. We prove that $N^{-m}Z_N(\Phi)$ converges a.s. and
$L^2$ to a universal explicit constant $C_m(\Phi)$.
